sentence.text: Genetic studies have identified a homozygous truncation mutation in endosome to lysosome transport that causes hypertonia in mice.
Moreover, elevated endosome to lysosome transport protein expression is associated with several types of cancers and variants in Trak1 are linked to childhood absence epilepsy in humans.
We found that hypertonia-associated mutation impairs endosome to lysosome transport mitochondrial localization and its ability to facilitate mitochondrial tethering and fusion.

Our findings uncover a novel function of endosome to lysosome transport as a regulator of mitochondrial fusion and provide evidence linking dysregulated mitochondrial dynamics to hypertonia pathogenesis
